- Soft-Fork a project

- Create a private release while honoring upstream SemVer

title: fix(bump): use commit meta to determine no bump commits
body: Use commit metadata configuration to get a list of non bump commits as using conventional commit type fix and feat does not take into account the dynamic configuration. This way only commits with bump_patch, bump_minor and breaking change get excluded from the list.

I've also made a fix to the GPG signing where it would not take into account the set program path in git config.

Tested: Ran `cargo nextest run` to ensure all local tests passed.

    Summary [   0.496s] 226 tests run: 226 passed, 0 skipped

title: docs(README): fix links to cocogitto docs
body: These two links would previously 404.

title: refactor(revspec): raise error instead of panicking when parsing `RevspecPattern`
body:
This PR updates the parsing logic for `RevspecPattern` to raise an error instead of panicking, by replacing the `From<&str>` implementation with `FromStr`, as discussed in https://github.com/cocogitto/cocogitto/pull/286#issue-1718201238.

Let me know if using a separate error enum/struct would be preferable instead of adding an enum variant to `Git2Error`, and if a `TryFrom` implementation would also be required.

title: style: rename 'Cog' to 'cog' internally
body: This makes the manpages and help outputs a little more cohesive.

title: Chore/git hook configs
body: We should wait for the new version to be released to merge this, otherwise CI will break

title: feat: Add configurable changelog omission for custom commit types
body:
PR enables configurable changelog omission by commit type, as requested in #214 

> **NOTE:** _implemenation is fairly naive, but is a completely functional "first draft" implementation_

title: refactor(cli): adjust cog-verify args
body:
Groups are better suited for this task, and arguably make for more readable code.

Also fills in missing flag docs.

title: feat(check): allow running check on commit range
body:
Closes #284.

The changes included in this PR allows accepting the commit range as an optional CLI argument. However, `clap` would raise an error if both `--from-latest-tag` and commit range are specified. This PR also includes some unit tests, let me know if any more tests are needed.

A problem that I see with the current implementation is that parsing a commit range from a string panics if the string is of an invalid format (check the `From<&str>` implementation of `RevspecPattern`). This would be a bad experience for the users. We should consider implementing `FromStr` or `TryFrom` instead, and raise an error instead of panicking. Depending on what's preferable, I can take this up on a separate PR.

title: Feat: custom commit hooks
body:
This PR change the install-hook command so it now install user defined hooks instead of the default ones. 

Custom hooks are now defined in cog.toml. 

**Example:**
```
[git-hooks]
pre-commit = { script = """
#!/bin/sh
cargo fmt --all --check && cargo clippy
"""}

commit-msg = { path = "git_hooks/commit-msg"}
```

Additionally running `cog commit` will now trigger git-hooks just like `git-commit` would. 

**Questions:**

Currently hook will fail with `cause: Exec format error (os error 8)` if a shebang is not provided. Should we provide a fallback shell ? If so would there be a crate to do that (manually parsing user defined hook and prepending a shebang seems a bit tedious. 

Closes #281 #268 #230  #223

title: feat(cli): add file parameter to verify command
body:
"cog verify" can now read the commit message from a file with the "-f" or "--file" parameter. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the "message" argument.

implement #279

title: Manpages v2
body:
I've taken a look at my original `cog generate-manpages` design and it seems unwieldy in hindsight. It requires unnecessary effort from a packager to manually discover subcommands and request them one by one. Also the generated manpages for subcommands are not correct since the perceived name is `foo-subcommand` instead of `cog-foo-subcommand`.

This switches to simply giving the command the directory for the output and then automatically creating all manpages ourselves.

One tidbit is having to enable the `string` clap feature in order to adjust the command names manually. This shouldn't be a big problem but I wanted to point out that it's there.

As an aside, I didn't mark this change as breaking since I don't think generating manpages should be considered a part of the main public API. I'd even be half inclined to set it as `chore` rather than `feat`.

title: feat(bump): support annotated tags
body:
Many projects use annotated commits for their releases. This commit extends `cog bump` with the `-A MSG`/`--annoted MSG` argument, which will create an annotated tag with the tag message `MSG`.

Much like the bump hooks, `{{version}}` and `{{latest}}` can be used in the provided tag message and will be replaced accordingly.

title: Fix/orphan commits
body: Closes #255

title: fix: disable help subcommand for `cog(1)`
body:
Hello! 🐻

From `cog(1)`:

```
SUBCOMMANDS
       Cog-help(1)
              Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)
```

However, it is not possible to generate a manpage for `cog-help` since it's a built-in command:

```sh
$ cog generate-manpage help

thread 'main' panicked at 'Requested non-existent subcommand', src/bin/cog/main.rs:487:22
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

This PR disables the help subcommand for `cog(1)` thus strips the `cog-help` section from manpage.

title: feat(cli): add subcommand for generating manpages
body:
As this feature might be a bit hard to discover, I also added  some documentation in `docs/Packaging.md`.

Discussion welcome! 😄

title: feat: add from_latest_tag to settings
body:
Without the ability to specify the `from_latest_tag` in the settings file it is very difficult to add cocogitto to an existing repository as you need to do one of the following:

* remember to only run `cog install-hook commit-msg` otherwise your pushes can fail depending on the local and remote states
* or manually edit the hooks, defeating the nice ux of the `cog install-hook` command

title: chore: bump clap version to 4.0
body:
Normally I would wait a bit more with a new clap release, but this one drops some dependencies (`indexmap`, `textwrap`).

Notable changes: clap has dropped help output coloring for now.

title: refactor: simplify project structure for binaries
body: Since we don't share the `commit` module between binaries anymore, this should be more readable

title: fix: fix stackover flow on 'oid..' resvpec
body:
In addition to fixing the endless recursion for this type of revspec tag revspec are now exclude the starting point. For instance '1.0.0..1.0.3' will collect all tags starting from >1.0.0. In the other hand, commit revspec starting point are inclusive.

#220 #227

title: fix: do not exit on parent not found (all_commits)
body:
When checking all the commits, `cog check` should not exit
if parent is not found because this is perfectly normal
when working in a shallow repository.

This patch modifies this behavior so the `all_commits` method
simply returns less commits (all the commits availables in the
shallow repository).

title: feat(commit): implement signed commit
body:
Originally we wanted to implement this with one of the following crates  : gpgme or sequoia.
But it turns out that using 'gpg' directly via std::process::Command
makes the implementation way simpler. Also the user is expected to have
gpg installed if they want to sign their work.

closes #91
